Alex Pan | #19

4th year from Novi, MI, studying Computer Science

The eldest of three, Alex Pan shined from a young age as a track star. He narrowly lost to B. Rabbit in the Michigan State Middle School Track Championship, and abruptly quit track to focus on Ultimate Frisbee. His brother Peter plays for Michigan MagnUM and his sister Sauce plays for Dartmouth Princess Layout. What an impressive family! #smallhandsbigheart

Ashwin Vaidyanathan | #17

4th year from Los Altos, CA, studying Electrical Engineering and Computer Science

As his defender struggles to spell his last name, Ashwin VajhdjjdAFXajkslauen sprints past them for a devastating upline into a power-position huck. Passionate about child education and bettering the world through smiles, Ashwin is the most eligible bachelor on the team, and if you want to learn more about his dance moves or work at Google, start a Venmo conversation with him @Ashwin-Vaidyanathan!.

Bo Rasmussen | #30

3rd year from Los Altos Hills, CA, studying Economics

Brian Kooperberg | #77

4th year from Seattle, WA, studying Computer Science

Koop is the flawless creation of two biostatistical genius geneticists. From a young age, Koop was trained in the vast arts of sports trivia, where his knowledge of anything going on in the sports world led to him wooing many girls across the frisbee universe. You might think that Koop doesn’t say much, and you’d be right! But, you might not have guessed that he’s protecting you from his unyielding seductive voice as he croons Josh Turner’s “Your Man”.

Chris Akers | #47

Graduate student from Baton Rouge, LA, studying Physics

Chris Lung | #22

3rd year from Sherman Oaks, CA, studying Materials Science and Engineering

Chris has been serving up the sauce with his throws all season, so much so that he is the first frisbee player to have been awarded the Michelin Star. Chef Chris never struggles to break his marks around with a savory selection of lefty backhands, inverts, and low releases. That’s not all, Chef Chris also specializes in desserts; with sweet skies downfield, and a presence on deep defense that helps Coach Dan sleep at night. In the words of Chris himself, “if I don’t have to move, it’s over.”

Drew Palmer | #8

1st year from Seattle, WA, studying Astrophysics

Evan Magsig | #32

1st year from Norman, OK, studying Civil Engineering

Glenn Wysen | #11

2nd year from Seattle, WA, studying Astro

It’s too bad this kid doesn’t have three N’s in his name because he’s always gunnin’ on the field! Born and raised by giants, it is no surprise that Glenn loves big hucks and huge skies. When he isn’t exposing fools on the field, he can be found buying four figure drones and selling them for 50 cent profits or eating that 0 out of 10/wasting away/death by paperclip feeling of a Dick’s Burg….. errrrrrrrrrr enjoying nerd life in Albuquerque, New Mexico.

Jace Bruner | #15

2nd year from San Anselmo, CA, studying Undeclared Engineering

Jace is really fast. Like, really really fast. At one point in time, he heard that a rocket ship travels at approximately 7 miles a second, to which he responded, “that’s it?”. When he’s not racing SpaceX rockets for fun, you can catch Jace in the gym 8 times a week. That’s one lift for each day, and one more to stunt on anyone who dares to guard him.

Jake McCurdy | #18

2nd year from South Pasadena, CA, studying Molecular Environmental Biology

Jake has spent the entire year laying the groundwork for UGMO’s success this year, with lots of behind the scenes logistics work and being one of the team’s crowdfunding leaders on his first year with the team. With fakes that will send you to the fourth-dimension, sideline talk that rivals the armed forces, not to mention filmmaking skills that rival Steven Spielberg, Jake is the complete package of a team player.

Joshua Yuan | #14

4th year from San Jose, CA, studying Computer Science

Standing at 7 feet and 11 inches, Joshua “Lil J” Yuan might just be the shortest monkey in the jungle, but he more than makes it up for it with his “fade away” sky. With this signature finishing move, Lil J elevates so high that the universe adjusts its gravitational pull on Joshua, making it seem like he’s falling. In reality, Lil J catches the disc, eats a 5-course meal on the Moon (our boy has a massive appetite), and then returns to Earth to grace us with - you know it- his classic smile.

Jules Fogarty | #7

2nd year from Orinda, CA, studying Econ

Liam Kreiss | #59

3rd year from Seattle, WA, studying EECS

Tuna is the team sweetheart, and you would never doubt that fact when you look at UGMO’s favorite camp counselor/safety officer/lifeguard/fish bro. He is always smiling, and keeps us smiling and healthy throughout the season. Whether he’s taping your ankle, bandaging your wound, brushing your teeth, or making you a romantic dinner, Tuna puts it all on the line to take care of you.

Mason Chupka | #3

3rd year from Davis, CA, studying

Coming from the swamps of Middle California, Mason has the reputation of a flaccid stalk of celery: hot out the oven. When he’s not biting squirrel heads off for their precious nectar you can find him greasing his vocabulary with a Webster’s Dictionary. His frisbee alias, Jeb Goldenfoot, can be seen lighting up any defense with his quick cuts, or shutting down the mark his wax-on-wax-off hand technique.

Max Williams | #87

1st year from Castro Valley, CA, studying Environmental Science

Munis Thahir | #12

2nd year from Chantilly, VA, studying Nuclear Engineering

Hatched in the nearby Potomac river, just like our first president, Guppy strives to make the Mid-Atlantic feel like a validated part of America. Three years ago, after finally breaking through the friend zone, eleven year old Guppy swam upstream. Once he reached California, he became hooked on the prospect of huge skies and layout Ds. You might recognize him from his Oscar winning performance as Giles in The Shape of Water. He may never bowl a strike, but he’ll probably spare you the fish puns.

Myron Liu | #10

4th year from Auckland, New Zealand, studying Computer Science and Chemical Engineering

Neil Thomas | #1

Graduate student from Santa Monica, CA, studying Computer Science PhD

Very few people know that Neil has been alive since the 16th century and was a well known playwright. He’s written classics such as “Romeo and Juliet”, “Hamlet”, and “The Taming of the Shrew.” Unfortunately, he was bitten by a vampire in his mid 20s and has been cursed with longevity. Fortunately, he has decided to join UGMO this season and is using his superhuman strength to terrorize opposing teams.

Rafael Castro | #4

3rd year from San Leandro, CA, studying Atmospheric Science

Ryan Lee | #88

2nd year from Sunnyvale, CA, studying Computer Science

Tommy Lin | #25

4th year from Sammamish, WA, studying Molecular Biology & Biochemistry

Sir Thomas Lin III, more commonly known as “Tommy”, has the best dimples on the team, the biggest quads on the team, and the biggest heart on the team. When he's not hiding from girls, Tommy can be spotted at every practice/tournament/film sesh bringing his boys up with him on his journey to glory. In other words, Tommy is Drake, and you can catch him running through the six with his throws every time he cleats up.

Trevor Aquino | #23

2nd year from San Jose, CA, studying Electrical Engineering and Computer Science

In just his first year of UGMO, Dingo has put in mad work to show up some of the nation’s best frisbee players. With his scrappiness on D, Trevor generates tons of blocks and causes tons of poor throws. None of that matters though, the real reason he’s on the team is his dance moves. He’s generated so many wins just by unnerving opponents with his sideline samba, he’s become a national sensation as the underdog candidate for Dancing with the Stars. He also gets the most girls on the team, that matters too I guess.

Vincent Su | #29

Graduate student from Bellaire, TX, studying Physics

Winston Tran | #2

3rd year from Davis, CA, studying Political Science
